alert.note: Alert for Elbert (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 7:44AM EST until January 04 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Elbert County in northeast Georgia. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 741 AM EST, Rainfall may top 3 inches in spots this morning, resulting in lingering, expanding and worsening high water conditions countywide. This is especially true along Beaverdam creek where flooding of low-lying areas is likely. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elberton, Bowman, Middleton, Russell State Park, Lake Russell, Nancy Hart State Park, Lake Strom Thurmond, Bobby Brown State Park, Ruckersville, Sweet City, Fortsonia, Dewy Rose, Rock Branch, Nuberg, Rice Town and Vanna. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
